Blog.post: This is my training schedule as of today. I've been doing this for a while now, gradually working up my running distance and time in the saddle so I feel good about completing (and in fair standing) the SC 1/2 Ironman in mid-September 2004. Monday Run 10 miles Circuit training at YMCA or at home on Bowflex for about an hour. Tuesday Swim 2,500-3,000m Bike 20-30 if decent out Wednesday Run 10 miles Circuit training at YMCA or at home on Bowflex for about an hour. Thursday Swim 2,500-3,000m Bike 20-30 if decent out Friday Run 10 miles Circuit training at YMCA or at home on Bowflex for about an hour. Saturday Bike 30-45 miles Sunday Active Rest It seems like a lot and not too well organized into actual training. This is too true. If I miss a day, I don't sweat it. Sometimes I may run, bike, or swim a little more or a little less. It depends on how I feel and the weather and how much time I can spend away from the family and still have peace at home. Train hard.

So I just discovered this blogging thing - yes, I'm behind the times a bit. I will try to post religeously but typically have little stick-to power on such things. Maybe this will be different - I don't know. At any rate, I hope to post here about my triathlon training until and maybe through the 2005 Florida Ironman. We'll see... Good blogging.

Okay. I signed up for Ironman USA yesterday. I was nervous about it, just pressing the button to confirm made me twitchy! But, it is done now. Only 361 days left to train...aaarrrggghhh! So I ran today. I felt terrible but made it through. I think I'm just too damned tired. I'm taking off a couple of days and going to catch up on some sleepy.
Great ride on Saturday. A small group busted off the main pack and headed out for an extra 25 miles (for 50 total) at a great pace. I felt Lance-like at times riding in a decent paceline.

Thursday, I got in a good, fast ride with some dudes at work. We rode on an unclompleted and unopened section of new highway loop. Unfortunately, about 10 miles in to it we got harassed by the man - yes the police came and told us to get off the highway. We were too "small" to ride on this unfinished section of road and we could sue the state if we got hurt. Okay...that makes perfect sense. At any rate, a couple of us shot off after that and paced around 20-22 for another 15 miles or so for a total of 30 @ 19.1 average. No too bad. We've made it a deal to try to ride every Wednesday out of work - just looking for a course now to get in 30 or more.

Well the Ironman-distance swim at Mountain Island Lake was a good course. The water was nearly 90F and there was a decent current because we were not in a protected cove but in the channel. My time was decent 1:12.13, but not good enought to place me in my age group - which shall remain nameless :-) I rested on Sunday and spent a lot of time this week at the gym doing weight training. I have also suggested to a co-worker and training partner that we sign up for Ironman USA vs. Ironman Florida. It is in a better time of year for us - summer vs. winter. It is also a tough-looking Ironman course, chock full of hills!

Wednesday, I ordered a new bike. I am pretty psyched about it - although it is setting me back some coin. I ordered a Serotta Concours CS. It is all Ti with carbon fiber seat stays. I also dove in for some custom paint - I chose a fade scheme (top to bottom) in Sapphire blue to Sunset (orange-red)with yellow "Serotta" decals on the tubes. If I can cut the pic from the CAD I will. I think I am going with Campy gruppo - likely the Chorus carbon, Bontrager Race X Lite wheelset, Selle Italia Prolink Ti Gel saddle with carbon Bontrager post. I have not looked at stems yet but will go with a zero degree rise or very slight since the bike is custom. More to come and pix if possible.
